Description: Conical sandstone tool with a flat base, very well smoothed, worked down around the edges of the base, chipped at one part. The upper side is conical and has a depression of 1.0 cm diameter and a depth of 0.7cm in the centre. The depressions is circular in section and is rounded at the end, the inside is well smoothed. The cone lies well in the hand, is well rounded and very even. Well-finished exterior. Some sort of grinding tool?
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 133)
